channel.title: Earth Data Science - Earth Lab
channel.description: A GitHub Jekyll Website maintained by Max Joseph and Leah Wasser

item.title: Visualizing hourly traffic crime data for Denver, Colorado using R, dplyr, and ggplot
item.description: This tutorial demonstrates how to access and visualize crime data for Denver, Colorado.
item.author: earth.lab@colorado.edu (Max Joseph)

item.title: Calculating the area of polygons in Google Earth Engine
item.description: This tutorial demonstrates polygon creation, perimeter and area calculations, and visualization using the JavaScript interface to Google Earth Engine.
item.author: earth.lab@colorado.edu (Matt Oakley)

item.title: Introduction to the Google Earth Engine Python API
item.description: This tutorial outlines the process of installing the Google Earth Engine Python API client.
item.author: earth.lab@colorado.edu (Matt Oakley)

item.title: Introduction to the Google Earth Engine code editor
item.description: This tutorial introduces the code editor in Google Earth Engine and shows how to use LandSat imagery using the JavaScript API.
item.author: earth.lab@colorado.edu (Matt Oakley)

item.title: Get Modis sinusoidal tile grid positions from latitude and longitude coordinates in Python
item.description: This tutorial demonstrates how to convert Modis sinusoidal tile grid positions to latitude and longitude in Python.
item.author: earth.lab@colorado.edu (Zach Schira)

item.title: Convert lat/lon coordinates to Landsat 8 path/row in Python
item.description: This tutorial demonstrates how to convert Landsat 8 path/row coordinates to latitude and longitude in Python.
item.author: earth.lab@colorado.edu (Zach Schira)

item.title: Using Leaflet and Folium to make interactive maps in Python
item.description: This tutorial shows how to make interactive maps in Python with folium.
item.author: earth.lab@colorado.edu (Matt Oakley)

item.title: Visualizing elevation contours from raster digital elevation models in Python
item.description: This tutorial shows how to compute and plot contour lines for elevation from a raster DEM (digital elevation model).
item.author: earth.lab@colorado.edu (Matt Oakley, Max Joseph)

item.title: Calculating slope and aspect from a digital elevation model in Python
item.description: This tutorial shows how to compute the slope and aspect from a digital elevation model in Python.
item.author: earth.lab@colorado.edu (Matt Oakley, Max Joseph)

item.title: DEPRECATED: Introduction to spatial regression in Python
item.author: earth.lab@colorado.edu (Zach Schira)

item.title: Computing raster statistics around buffered spatial points Python
item.description: This tutorial shows how to compute raster statistics like the mean and variance around buffered spatial points in Python.
item.author: earth.lab@colorado.edu (Matt Oakley, Max Joseph)

item.title: Acquiring streamflow data from USGS with climata and Python
item.description: This tutorial demonstrates how to use climata to acquire streamflow data in and around Boulder, Colorado.
item.author: earth.lab@colorado.edu (Max Joseph)

item.title: Computing and plotting 2d spatial point density in R
item.description: This tutorial demonstrates how to compute 2d spatial density and visualize the result using storm event data from NOAA.
item.author: earth.lab@colorado.edu (Max Joseph)

item.title: Using R and Python in the same Jupyter notebook
item.description: This tutorial shows how to use rpy2 in a Jupyter notebook to run both R and Python.
item.author: earth.lab@colorado.edu (Matt Oakley)

item.title: Acquiring U.S. census data with Python and cenpy - Deprecated lesson
item.author: earth.lab@colorado.edu (Zach Schira)

item.title: Create rasters from SMAP data in Python
item.description: This tutorial demonstrates how to access SMAP data, and how to generate raster output from this data.
item.author: earth.lab@colorado.edu (Matt Oakley, Zach Schira)
